docblock.description: Starting point for making a http requests.
docblock.long-description:
Uses builder pattern making your code easy to write, and easy to understand. A basic example of usage would be:

$response = HttpRequest::build("https://example.com")
    ->method("POST")
    ->contentType("application/json")
    ->entity(json_encode($entity))
    ->proxy("http://user:password@192.168.0.1:8080")
    ->accept("application/json")
    ->execute();

echo $response->getEntity()->field;

docblock.description: Returns request constructed for the $url.
docblock.long-description:
Basicly, it does nothing but new HttpRequest($url);, however making it possible to write a request without assigning link to it, f.ex.
HttpRequest::build("https://example.com")->async(true)->execute();
In future some other logic may be added to this method, so it is recomended to be used instead of constructor. NOTICE! an url containing user:pass section.

docblock.description: Constructs a new HttpRequest with a given url.
Set's a http request header.
docblock.long-description:
NOTICE! A validation is performed, according to RFC822 section 3.1, triggering a warning if not valid.
If a headers containing an underscore, would be concerned partialy valid, as they are valid by RFC822, but not recognized well by most http servers (becouse of CGI env variables naming).

docblock.description: Set's a request method.
Set's a request query parameter, to be appended into request query.
docblock.long-description: Parameter would be urlencoded automatically, so you don't have to make any encoding by yourself.

docblock.description: Set's an entity to be used in HttpRequest.
docblock.long-description:
Could be of any type, conversion will be made using when sending a request with a {@link contentType($type)} set.
If a content type, or type of entity are not recognized, conversion to string will be obtained.
If request type does not asume any entity (GET, HEAD), it will be ignored.

docblock.description: A content type of the entity.
docblock.long-description:
Asumes a format of [type "/" subtype], as described in RFC 2615 section 3.6.1.
Content type is further used to convert entity into string (if necessary) while sending a request body, and is set into 'Content-Type' header.
NOTICE! Any data after semicolon (";") will be lost.

docblock.description: Charset to be set for the request entity.
docblock.long-description:
Any entity is converted to specified charset, when sending request body.
Default value is 'ISO-8859-1'

docblock.description: Set's an 'Accept' http header.
docblock.long-description: Is validated like {@see contentType}, except data after semicolon is not been removed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: contentType, expected to be returned in response. May be eather string, or an array of strings (any of type listed is acceptable).

docblock.description: Set's up a proxy to be used in request.
docblock.long-description: Can also be made setting an environment variables 'httpclient.proxy.url' and 'httpclient.noproxy'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an url string or an instance of {@see HttpProxy}

docblock.description: Set's a stream context {@see stream_context_create()} to be used when opening a socket to remote http server.
Set's a timeout used when establishing socket connection.
Set's a timeout for reading from socket (a max time, that socket may be opened after connected).
Switches a request into async/sync mode.
docblock.long-description:
If an async mode is used, no reading from socket is made, client just send's a request as is, no response is actually returned.
Is usefull, when 'in only' pattern is used.

docblock.description: Executes a request, and returnes a response.
Writes a request body into a given socket connection.
docblock.long-description: Is usefull when you want to debug a request, writing diretly to STDOUT or file.

docblock.description: Returnes whether SSL will be used in connection or not.
Returnes a remote server port.
Returns a remote server hostname.
Returnes a stream context to be used in request.
Returns a connection timeout.
Returnes a read timeout.

docblock.description: A class for obtaining a connection via HTTP(s) proxy.
docblock.long-description: An instance of this class does not change it's state between connections, thereofore may be safely used several times during one process.

docblock.description: Constructor for the proxy, may be early initialized by passing url string, or lately, using builder methods.
Sets username for authorization.
Sets password for authorization.
Sets proxy hostname.
Sets proxy port (default is 8080).
Sets a noproxy range(s) for skipping while making a socket connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an array (or a single string) of hostnames, ip addresses, network ranges to be skipped by proxy.

docblock.description: Connects to a proxy, making CONNECT request using instance of {@see HttpRequest} for obtaining host and port.

tag.name: return
tag.description: socket connection to a proxy, ready for writing a request

tag.name: throws
tag.description: in case a connection could not be made, or proxy returned any status except for 200

parse_markers.error: No summary was found for this file

Argument $request is missing from the Docblock of connectViaTCP()
Argument $request is missing from the Docblock of doConnect()

docblock.description: Describes response of http server, provides methods for fast access to different response parts.
Creates new HttpResponse, reading it from input sream of the given resource.
docblock.long-description:
In most cases Response is not constructed manually, however it may be 'mocked' by opening a file containing raw http response, and passing file descriptor to a constructor f.ex. 
$fp = fopen('response.raw');
$resp = new HttpResponse($fp);

docblock.description: Returns http headers in a form of array.
docblock.long-description: NOTICE! All header names will be lowercased, as far as they have to be case insensitive. If you need to obtain an information about a concrete header, use {@see getHeader}

docblock.description: Returns value for the header with a given name.
docblock.long-description: NOTICE! Header names are case insensitive.

tag.name: return
tag.description: header value, or null if no header for the given name exist.

docblock.description: Returns a 'raw' http entity.
docblock.long-description: No conversion is made, and everything after header section of the response (without leading CRLF) is returned.

docblock.description:
Returns a http status code of the response, is a first part of status line.
200 OK HTTP/1.1

tag.name: return
tag.description: http status, or '0', if response could not be parsed.

docblock.description:
Returns reason phrase, is a second part of status line.
200 OK HTTP/1.1

Return http version, in form of HTTP/{MAJOR}.{MINOR}
200 OK HTTP/1.1
Returns content type in form type/subtype.
Returns charset.

tag.name: return
tag.description: charset parsed from request or default "ISO-8859-1"

docblock.description: Returns http entity parsed form response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: an object representation of an entity, depending on a content-type

parse_markers.error: No summary was found for this file
Argument $line is missing from the Docblock of parseStatusLine()
Argument $line is missing from the Docblock of parseHeader()

docblock.description: Utility functions for HttpClient.
docblock.long-description: This file is required to be included, if you are using HttpClient.

docblock.description: HttpClient autoloader.

tag.name: param
tag.description: name of the class to be looked for

tag.name: return
tag.description: if the following class was loaded

docblock.description: Checks if a given ip is in a network range.

tag.name: param
tag.description: IP to check in IPV4 format eg. 127.0.0.1

tag.name: param
tag.description: IP/CIDR netmask eg. 127.0.0.0/24, also 127.0.0.1 is accepted and /32 assumed

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the ip is in this range / false if not.

docblock.description: Builds a new {@see \org\projasource\httpclient\HttpRequest}.
docblock.long-description: An alias for {@see \org\projasource\httpclient\HttpRequest::build($url)}.
